Dear Mrs. Butuma,



I just returned from ahunting trip that should have been a refreshing respite from the hustle and bustle of daily business but it was not without its harrowing moments.My friend Mr. McCreevy and I went hunting in the Wexford Forest for the elusive celtic tiger.Well this animal is so rare that it was once thought by the ancient Irish of the last millenium to be immortal but further study has proven that its true lifespan is only ten years at most.



In any case, Mr. McCreevy managed to spot one of the beasts in a meadow whenceforth he proceeded to lock and aim his rifle.Unfortunately he is a poor shot and the rifle's loud report startled the tiger and caused it to charge my poor friend whom I thought surely must die from the encounter. To our surprise the large cat bounded out of the meadow and onto the N81 motorway whereupon it was swiftly run down by a speeding motorbus.

I hope I have not troubled you with my tale of woe nor given you cause to doubt my honesty and trustworthiness by relating to you my acts of bribery. Rather let me assure you that this just how business is done in this Emerald Isle.We Irish have a saying that 'one hand washes the other and both hands wash the face.'Palms must be greased and there is often no way around that.



Your phone numbers still do not work.I get disconnected most of the time and other times the line is engaged.I think I have found a trustworthy banker who can handle this and won't feck off with the money.



your Seamus
